intro: Fabiana punensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, often at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Fabiana punensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
